subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition
contentHtml:
The QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that allows us to represent a matrix as the product of an orthogonal matrix and an upper triangular matrix.

This decomposition is particularly useful when working with matrices that have a specific structure, such as those arising from Gaussian elimination or Gram-Schmidt process.
intuition: The key insight is that the orthogonal matrix Q captures the structure of the input matrix A, while the upper triangular matrix R reveals the underlying relationships between the columns of A.
realWorldApplications: Principal component analysis (PCA) in machine learning
commonMistakes: Failing to recognize that QR decomposition is not unique; different factorizations may exist for the same matrix.

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition
contentHtml:
The QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that helps us understand how matrices can be factored into an orthogonal matrix and an upper triangular matrix.

This decomposition has numerous applications in machine learning, particularly in topics like principal component analysis (PCA) and singular value decomposition (SVD).
intuition: Think of the QR decomposition as a way to 'rotate' your data into a more meaningful coordinate system. The orthogonal matrix Q helps you align your data with the most important features, while the upper triangular matrix R reveals the underlying structure of your data.
commonMistakes: Assuming QR decomposition is only used for solving systems of linear equations

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition
contentHtml:
QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that helps us decompose a matrix into an orthogonal matrix and an upper triangular matrix.

This process is crucial for many applications, including machine learning and artificial intelligence.
intuition: Think of QR decomposition as a way to 'rotate' the columns of a matrix so that they become more independent. This helps us solve systems of linear equations more efficiently.
realWorldApplications: Principal component analysis (PCA) in machine learning
commonMistakes: Thinking QR decomposition is only for matrices with full column rank

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition
contentHtml:
The QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that has numerous applications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

Given a matrix A, the QR decomposition expresses A as the product of an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R:

\(\mathbf{A} = \mathbf{QR}\)

This decomposition is particularly useful when working with matrices that have orthonormal columns, such as those arising from principal component analysis (PCA).

",
name: QR Decomposition" },
problemHtml: Suppose we have a matrix A that represents the coefficients of a linear regression model. We want to decompose A into its orthogonal and upper triangular components using QR decomposition.
explanation: The R matrix is upper triangular and contains the coefficients of the linear regression model." } ],
finalAnswer: The QR decomposition of A is Q and R" },
intuition: QR decomposition provides a way to factorize a matrix into its orthogonal and upper triangular components, which can be useful in various machine learning and artificial intelligence applications.

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition Theorem
contentHtml: The QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that has far-reaching implications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

formula.latex: \[ Q R = P \left( \begin{array}{cc} R_{11} & R_{12} \\ 0 & R_{22} \end{array} \right) \]
formula.name: QR Decomposition

theorem.statement: \[ \exists Q, R \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}, P \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n} : A = QR, Q^T Q = I, R = \begin{bmatrix} R_{11} & R_{12} \\ 0 & R_{22} \end{bmatrix} \]
theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the Gram-Schmidt process can be used to construct an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.

intuition: QR decomposition is a way to factorize a matrix into an orthogonal matrix and an upper triangular matrix, which has important implications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition Theorem
contentHtml: The QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that has far-reaching implications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

theorem.statement: \[ \text{Given a matrix } \mathbf{A} \in \mathbb{R}^{m\times n}, \text{there exists an orthogonal matrix } \mathbf{Q} \in \mathbb{R}^{m\times m} \text{ and an upper triangular matrix } \mathbf{R} \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times n} \text{ such that } \mathbf{A} = \mathbf{Q}\mathbf{R}. \]
theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the QR decomposition is equivalent to a Gram-Schmidt process and then using the properties of orthogonal matrices.

intuition: The QR decomposition provides a way to factorize a matrix into an orthogonal part (capturing the directions) and an upper triangular part (capturing the scales). This has important implications for many machine learning algorithms, such as principal component analysis and singular value decomposition.

subject: linear_algebra
statementHtml: Given a matrix A ∈ ℝ<sup>m×n</sup>, show that QR decomposition exists and provide an algorithm to compute it.
hints: Think about the properties of orthogonal matrices.
Recall the Gram-Schmidt process for constructing an orthonormal basis.
The key is to find a sequence of orthogonal transformations.
solutionHtml:
To prove existence, consider the following steps:

  1. \(Q_1 = \frac{\mathbf{a}_1}{\|\mathbf{a}_1\|}\), where \(\mathbf{a}_1\) is the first column of A.
  2. For \(k ≥ 2\), define \(Q_k\) as the matrix that orthogonalizes the columns of \(Q_{k-1}A\).
  3. The sequence converges to an orthogonal matrix Q.

To compute QR, iterate:

  1. \(R_0 = A\)
  2. For \(k ≥ 1\), update:
    • \(Q_k\) as above
    • \(R_{k+1} = R_k Q_k^T\)

    The final answer is QR.

    ",
answerShort: QR decomposition exists and can be computed using the Gram-Schmidt process." },

subject: linear_algebra
statementHtml: Given a matrix A, decompose it into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.
hints: Start by considering the Gram-Schmidt process.
Think about how to preserve orthogonality during the decomposition.
Use the fact that QR = A.
solutionHtml:
To decompose A into Q and R, we can use the Gram-Schmidt process.

Let's start with the first column of A. We'll normalize it to get the first column of Q:

\(\mathbf{q}_1 = \frac{\mathbf{a}_1}{\|\mathbf{a}_1\|}\)

Next, we'll subtract the projection of the second column onto the first column from the second column:

\(\mathbf{r}_2 = \mathbf{a}_2 - \proj_{\mathbf{q}_1}(\mathbf{a}_2)\)

We can repeat this process for each subsequent column.

",
answerShort: The QR decomposition of A is Q and R." },

subject: linear_algebra

problem.statementHtml: Given a matrix A, decompose it into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.
hints: Start by considering the Gram-Schmidt process for orthogonalization.
Think about how to modify the QR decomposition to ensure orthogonality.
Recall that the dot product of two vectors is 0 if they are orthogonal.
problem.solutionHtml:
To decompose A into Q and R, first compute the Gram-Schmidt process for the columns of A. This will give you an orthonormal basis for the column space of A.

Next, construct Q by stacking these orthonormal vectors as columns.

Finally, set R equal to the matrix whose columns are the original columns of A, but with each column normalized to have length 1.

commonMistakes: Forgetting to normalize the columns of R
Not ensuring that Q is an orthogonal matrix

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition: Orthogonal × Upper Triangular
statementHtml: Given a matrix A ∈ ℝ^(m×n), find an orthogonal matrix Q ∈ ℝ^(m×m) and an upper triangular matrix R ∈ ℝ^(n×n) such that A = QR.
hints: Hint: Start with the Gram-Schmidt process
solutionHtml: To solve this problem, we'll use the Gram-Schmidt process to orthogonalize the columns of A. We'll then construct Q and R.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the first orthogonal vector", "mathHtml": "\[q_1 = \frac{\mathbf{a}_1}{\|\mathbf{a}_1\|} = \frac{\begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 3\end{bmatrix}}{\sqrt{10}}\]", "explanation": "We normalize the first column of A."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Find the second orthogonal vector", "mathHtml": "\[q_2 = \frac{\mathbf{a}_2 - \text{proj}_{q_1}(\mathbf{a}_2)}{\|\mathbf{a}_2 - \text{proj}_{q_1}(\mathbf{a}_2)\|}\]", "explanation": "We subtract the projection of the second column onto the first orthogonal vector."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Construct Q and R", "mathHtml": "\[Q = \begin{bmatrix}q_1 & q_2\end{bmatrix}, R = \begin{bmatrix}5 & 3 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix}\]", "explanation": "We combine the orthogonal vectors to form Q, and the remaining columns of A form R."}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Verify QR decomposition", "mathHtml": "\[A = QR = \begin{bmatrix}q_1 & q_2\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}5 & 3 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4\end{bmatrix}\]", "explanation": "We verify that A is equal to the product of Q and R."}, ],
intuition: QR decomposition is a powerful tool for orthogonalizing vectors and upper-triangularizing matrices. It has numerous applications in machine learning, such as principal component analysis (PCA) and singular value decomposition (SVD).

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition: Orthogonal × Upper Triangular
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll demonstrate how to solve a problem step-by-step using QR decomposition.

formula.latex: \[Q R = \begin{bmatrix} q_{11} & q_{12} \\ q_{21} & q_{22} \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} r_{11} & r_{12} \\ 0 & r_{22} \end{bmatrix}\]
formula.name: QR Decomposition

problem.statementHtml: Given a matrix A, find the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.
problem.solutionHtml:
Solution:

  • Step 1: Normalize the first column of A to get q_{11}. Math: \(q_{11} = \frac{a_{11}}{|a_{11}|}\). Why: This ensures that Q is orthogonal.
  • Step 2: Subtract the projection of the second column onto the first column from the second column. Math: \(r_{12} = a_{12} - q_{11}^T a_{22}\). Why: This eliminates the inner product between the columns, making R upper triangular.
  • Step 3: Repeat Steps 1 and 2 for each subsequent column until all columns are processed.

workedExample.problemHtml: Given A = \[\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix}\], find Q and R such that A = QR.

intuition: QR decomposition is a powerful tool for solving systems of linear equations and computing eigenvalues.

subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition: Orthogonal × Upper Triangular
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll demonstrate how to solve a problem step-by-step using QR decomposition.
name: QR Decomposition" },
statementHtml: Given the matrix A, decompose it into a product of an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.
problemHtml: Decompose the matrix A = \[\begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4\end{bmatrix}\] into Q and R.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the first column of Q", "mathHtml": "\\[q_1 = \\frac{a_{1,1}}{||a_{:,1}||}\\]", "explanation": "We normalize the first column to ensure it has length 1."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Find the second column of Q", "mathHtml": "\\[q_2 = a_{2,1} - \\frac{a_{2,1}}{||a_{:,1}||}\\cdot q_1\\]", "explanation": "We subtract the projection of the second column onto the first to ensure orthogonality."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find R", "mathHtml": "\\[R = Q^T A\\]", "explanation": "We compute R by multiplying Q transpose with A."}, {"stepNumber": 4", "description": "Verify the decomposition", "mathHtml": "", "explanation": "We can verify that QT R = A by computing the product and comparing it to the original matrix."} ],
intuition: QR decomposition is a powerful tool for solving systems of linear equations and computing eigenvalues.
visualDescription: A diagram showing the QR decomposition process would be helpful in visualizing the steps.
